edu.neu.ccis.sms.listener

Class SMSContextListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.neu.ccis.sms.listener.SMSContextListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, javax.servlet.ServletContextListener

    @WebListener
public class SMSContextListener
extends Object
implements javax.servlet.ServletContextListener
    Setup the context for an individual application instance, including configuring Application Terminology, Hibernate and Alfrseco. Implements ServletContextListener interface, overriding contextInitialized and contextDestroyed events
    Since:
    May 17, 2015
    Version:
    SMS 1.0
    Author:
    Swapnil Gupta

    • Constructor Detail

      • SMSContextListener

        public SMSContextListener()
        Loads terminology from configuration sources and reads data into data structures for future access. List of data structures is documented in @see setupTerminologyConfigurationInContext

    • Method Detail

      • contextInitialized

      • setupTerminologyConfigurationInContext

        private void setupTerminologyConfigurationInContext(javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
        Setup terminology configuration in servlet context including few frequently used data structures. 1. ContextKeys.TERMINOLOGY_CONFIG) : configuration containing the terminology for current application context. 2. ContextKeys.CATEGORY_TO_PROPERTY_KEY): category mapped to its property key in the terminology configuration. 3. ContextKeys.CATEGORY_TO_ATTRIBUTES): category mapped to its attributes in the terminology configuration. 4. ContextKeys.CATEGORY_TO_PARENT) : category mapped to its parent in the terminology configuration. 5. ContextKeys.CATEGORY_TO_PARENT) : set of registrables in given terminology. 6. ContextKeys.CATEGORY_TO_PARENT) : set of submittables in given terminology. 7. edu.neu.ccis.sms.constants.ContextKeys#ROLES_ROOT_ELEMENT) : role key in terminology configuration mapped to its role in the current context.
        Parameters:
        context - servlet context for current application instance

      • insertNewCategoriesFromTerminology

        private void insertNewCategoriesFromTerminology()
        Inserts all the categories in the current terminology, if they already do not exist in database. If existing categories are encountered they are ignored. Categories need to be unique across all terminologies, although they can be same for different instances of same terminology configuration.

      • insertRootCategoryMember

        private void insertRootCategoryMember()
        Inserts the member for root category, this can be only done during the system startup. Member name needs to be unique for the given root category. On system restart or if the name corresponding to an existing member is used it will ignored and this will be logged in the logs. The name of this member is specified the configuration xml using the attribute. ConfigKeys.HIERARCHY_ROOT_MEMBER_ELEMENT If the root member is being newly created, it is assigned a conductor with the username specified in the ConfigKeys.HIERARCHY_ROOT_USERNAME_ELEMENT

      • createConductorForMember

        private void createConductorForMember(String rootCategoryPropertyKey,
                            Member rootMember)
        Creates the user specified in the configuration files as the condcutor for this new root member, if the user not already the conductor
        Parameters:
        rootCategoryPropertyKey - the property key for root category
        rootMember - the newly created root member which needs to have a conductor
